answers.answer: For a normal no complications pregnancy that's all you usually get.  If you are high risk, Dr has concerns or you have a condition like gestational diabetes you may get more.  I'm high risk and have been getting scans weekly since 32 weeks.  It seems a bit much to me but whatever dr thinks is best for baby.

What wookiemom said. My babys due date keeps changing so i get them somewhat more often. My 3rd will be at 22 ish weeks, around chrismas.  Then i might not get another. Ill Possibly get one towards the end just to make sure her measurments n everything still add up to my due date
Two is normal. One at the beginning, one to get the gender. If you go overdue some doctors like to schedule another one just to make sure everything is going ok with baby.
Im 34 weeks and have had three and next month will be my fourth one. I'm not high risk or anything.
I literally have had 6ultrasounds my whole pregnancy

My first pregnancy I was high risk so I had a lot of ultrasounds most of them were 3d I got to see my princess a lot I had around 10 my whole pregnancy and i deliverd at only 32 weeks .Now I am only 17 weeks pregnant and I already had 3 and my next is on Monday I will be having one every 2 weeks from now on until I give birth because the doctor wants to monitor my cervical length , so good luck everyone and enjoy being pregnant
And sorry I forgot to add that 2 ultrasounds in normal because you aren't high risk , both my sisters only had 2 in all there pregnancies
I've had about 6. My doctor had some concerns so that may be why I have had so many. So far my little boy is doing fine and I'm almost 27 weeks.
Two is normally all BCBS will pay for unless you're considered high risk. You can always go to one of those independent ultrasound places. I think a 3D ultrasound runs about $200 out of pocket.
Ive got my 4th ultrasound in 2 days and im only 20 weeks. I had one at 3, 6,14 and soon to be 20. Im not high risk..

question: How many ultrasounds per say are you suppose to receive? Being only 34 weeks I've only had two. One at 12 weeks and another at 22 weeks.
title: Ultrasounds
